expectedlifedate.title: Expected EOL
expectedlifedate.remarks: The date that the asset reaches the expected useful life date. This date is calculated by using the Asset's original installation date and its expected useful life, which is defined by manufacturer or industry standard.

pluscsumeu.title: Accuracy EU
pluscsumeu.remarks: This field is summed with the %Span, %URV, and %Reading EU fields to obtain the total accuracy of the asset.

productid.title: Product ID
productid.remarks: Product ID, relates an asset to a product

startwonum.title: Start Work Order
startwonum.remarks: NP field for starting work order number.

startdate.title: Start Date
startdate.remarks: NP date time field representing the start date.

industryhealthscore.title: Industry Standard Health Score
industryhealthscore.remarks: Industry standard health score in numeric format

pluscsumspan.title: %SPAN
pluscsumspan.remarks: This field is summed with the %Reading, %URV, and Accuracy EU fields to obtain the total accuracy of the asset.

startmeasure.title: Start Measure
startmeasure.remarks: A value that identifies the start of the linear asset.  The absolute value of the end measure minus the start measure will determine the length of the linear asset.  The start measure and the end measure also determine the boundary measures for any features or relationships applied to the asset.

pluscisinhousecal.title: Internal Calibration
pluscisinhousecal.remarks: When selected indicates that this tool is calibrated in house. The default is cleared.

pluscvendor.title: Calibration Vendor
pluscvendor.remarks: Vendor/Facility that does the actual calibration.

removefromactivesp.title: Remove Asset Reference from Active Safety Plans
removefromactivesp.remarks: Remove Asset Reference from Active Safety Plans

pluscoprgeto.title: To
pluscoprgeto.remarks: Enter the maximum numeric value of the operating range of the tool. This field is used in conjuction with the Operating Range From field.

methodname.title: Scoring Method
methodname.remarks: The scoring method applied to the asset.

modelid.title: Import ID
modelid.remarks: Import ID Typically from a BIM model or COBie data set.

enddescription.title: Asset End
enddescription.remarks: Free-form text describing the end of this linear asset.

depreciationpending.title: Depreciation Pending
depreciationpending.remarks: Indicates that generation of the depreciation schedule is pending final receipt or invoice of the PO that this rotating asset was purchased on.

sinceinstall.title: Since Install
sinceinstall.remarks: Difference between the current meter reading and the meter reading when this AssetMeter's asset was moved into its current configuration.

startassetfeatureid.title: Start Asset Feature ID
startassetfeatureid.remarks: A previously defined feature or relationship used, in conjunction with the start offset, to determine the start measure for this meter.

startmeasure.title: Start Measure
startmeasure.remarks: Absolute distance taken from the start of the linear asset to where this meter is defined.  This can be manually entered or calculated by entering a start reference point and start offset.

domainid.title: Domain
domainid.remarks: This domain information is used to validate a new CHARACTERISTIC measurement.

endoffsetunitid.title: Unit of End Offset
endoffsetunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for the offset (before or after) from the end reference point of this meter.

sincelastinspect.title: Since Last Inspection
sincelastinspect.remarks: Difference between the current meter reading and the meter reading when the last work order of type INSPECTION was opened or closed as determined by application setup.

endzoffset.title: End Z Offset
endzoffset.remarks: Distance above or below this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet above the road, the  Z-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Z  Reference Point and can be positive (above) or negative (below).

endbasemeasure.title: End Base Measure
endbasemeasure.remarks: An absolute measure that is calculated by converting from the end measure using a defined conversion method.  Conversion methods are defined in the Assets application using the Add/Modify Conversions action.

active.title: Active
active.remarks: Is this asset's meter available to accept manual or rolled down readings, or to be used in PM or CM work order generation?

changedate.title: Changed Date
changedate.remarks: Date and time record was last modified.

previousreadingdate.title: Previous Reading Date
previousreadingdate.remarks: non-persistent attribute that is the date of the reading just previous to the meter reading being added or updated.

sincelastrepair.title: Since Last Repair
sincelastrepair.remarks: Difference between current meter reading and the meter reading when the last work order was opened or closed as determined by the application setup.

startoffsetunitid.title: Unit of Start Offset
startoffsetunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for the offset (before or after) from the start reference point of this meter.

startfeatureid.title: StartFeature ID
startfeatureid.remarks: unique identifier for the feature that marks the start of the section of the linear asset for which this meter applies

startfeature.title: Start Feature
startfeature.remarks: The feature (e.g. mile marker) that is used to identify where, on the linear asset, the meter reading was taken.

measureunitid.title: Unit of Measure
measureunitid.remarks: Measure unit for the meter when attached to this asset, for example LITERS or RPM

reason.title: Reason
reason.remarks: reason for modification to historical meter reading

rolldownid.title: Rolldown Identifier
rolldownid.remarks: Identifier that makes it possible to find all readings that were added during the same rolldown.

locmeterreadingid.title: Location Meter Reading Identifier
locmeterreadingid.remarks: The AssetMeter's location's LocMeterReadingId when this meter reading is rolled down from the location.

meterreadingid.title: Meter Reading ID
meterreadingid.remarks: Unique identifier for this meter reading. This value is automatically generated for each new meter reading.

startassetfeatureid.title: Start Feature
startassetfeatureid.remarks: A previously defined feature or relationship used, in conjunction with the start offset, to determine the start measure for this meter.

delta.title: Delta
delta.remarks: Difference between this and the last meter reading. The actual reading is recorded separately in the Reading column.

readingdate.title: Reading Date
readingdate.remarks: Date and time that this meter reading is being entered. The value defaults to the system date and time, but the user can modify it as long as it is not in the future.

startmeasure.title: Start Measure
startmeasure.remarks: Absolute distance taken from the start of the linear asset to where this meter is defined.  This can be manually entered or calculated by entering a start reference point and start offset.

endoffsetunitid.title: Unit of End Offset
endoffsetunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for the offset (before or after) from the end reference point where this meter reading was taken.

inheritedfromasset.title: Inherited From
inheritedfromasset.remarks: Asset from which reading has been INHERITED during rolldown

endzoffset.title: End Z Offset
endzoffset.remarks: Distance above or below this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet above the road, the  Z-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Z  Reference Point and can be positive (above) or negative (below).

modified.title: Modified
modified.remarks: True if this meterreading has been modified either directly or indirectly, that is, via the rolling down or forward of a modification through the asset hierarchy and reading history.

endbasemeasure.title: End Base Measure
endbasemeasure.remarks: An absolute measure that is calculated by converting from the end measure using a defined conversion method.  Conversion methods are defined in the Assets application using the Add/Modify Conversions action.

startoffsetunitid.title: Unit of Start Offset
startoffsetunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for the offset (before or after) from the start reference point where this meter reading was taken.

enterby.title: Entered By
enterby.remarks: Current login name - cannot be modified by user.

measureunitid.title: Unit of Measure
measureunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for this meter reading.

startoffset.title: Start Offset
startoffset.remarks: Distance used in conjunction with the start reference point to determine where the meter resides.

endassetfeatureid.title: End Feature
endassetfeatureid.remarks: A previously defined feature or relationship used, in conjunction with the end offset to determine the end measure for this meter.

dorollover.title: Rollover
dorollover.remarks: non-persistent attribute to indicate if a reading update will cause the meter to roll over

endoffset.title: End Offset
endoffset.remarks: Distance used in conjunction with the end reference point to determine where the meter resides.

startfeaturelabel.title: Reference Point
startfeaturelabel.remarks: label used to identify the specific AssetFeature used to locate the start of the range on this linear asset for which this meterreading applies

endfeaturelabel.title: Reference Point
endfeaturelabel.remarks: label used to identify the specific AssetFeature used to locate the end of the range on this linear asset for which this meterreading applies

endyoffsetref.title: End Y Offset Referent
endyoffsetref.remarks: Point from which the Y Offset End is measured, for example, centerline or edge.

startzoffset.title: Start Z Offset
startzoffset.remarks: Distance above or below this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet above the road, the  Z-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Z  Reference Point and can be positive (above) or negative (below).

rollover.title: Rollover
rollover.remarks: Point at which the asset's meter returns to the its mininum value. Rollover applies to CONTINUOUS meters only.

startzoffsetref.title: Start Z Offset Referent
startzoffsetref.remarks: Reference point from which the start Z-Offset (distance above or below the linear asset) is measured.

startyoffsetref.title: Start Y Offset Referent
startyoffsetref.remarks: Point from which the Y Offset Start is measured, for example, centerline or edge.

enterdate.title: Entered Date
enterdate.remarks: System date and time when the MeterReading was entered - cannot be modified by user.

basemeasureunitid.title: Unit of Base Measure
basemeasureunitid.remarks: Usually, this is the same as the unit of measure  for the asset. If they differ, Maximo will display measures in the unit of measure but will store measures in both the unit of measure and base unit of measure.  A conversion between the unit of measure and base unit of measure, entered via the Units of Measure and Conversion Action in Assets, must exist if the base unit of measure differs from the unit of measure.

endmeasure.title: End Measure
endmeasure.remarks: Absolute distance taken from the start of the linear asset to where the end of this meter is defined.  This can be manually entered or calculated by entering an end reference point and end offset.

startyoffset.title: Start Y Offset
startyoffset.remarks: Perpendicular distance from this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet to the right of the road, the Y-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Y Reference Point and can be positive (right) or negative (left).

reading.title: Reading
reading.remarks: Actual reading for the meter. The delta is recorded separately in the Delta column.

didrollover.title: Did Reading Roll Over
didrollover.remarks: Yes/No flag indicating whether a rollover occured during the setting of this meter reading's value.

inspector.title: Inspector
inspector.remarks: Person who reported the meter reading.

readingsource.title: Source
readingsource.remarks: Source of this meter reading. A new reading can be a direct entry by the user, an inherited value from a parent asset's or locations meter or a modification.

endyoffset.title: End Y Offset
endyoffset.remarks: Perpendicular distance from this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet to the right of the road, the Y-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Y Reference Point and can be positive (right) or negative (left).

assetid.title: Asset
assetid.remarks: unique identifier for this MeterReading's Asset

matusetransid.title: Issue Identifier
matusetransid.remarks: if this reading resulted from the issue of an item that had a metername corresponding to the metername of the issue's target asset, this attribute is populated with the MatUseTransId of the orginating MatUseTrans ISSUE transaction.

readingtype.title: Reading Type
readingtype.remarks: Reading can be ACTUAL or DELTA.

rolldownsource.title: Rolldown Source
rolldownsource.remarks: If this meter reading is the result of a rolldown, this attribute indicates the source of the rolldown, ASSET, LOCATION or NONE. NONE indicates that this meter reading was not the result of a rolldown.

startbasemeasure.title: Start Base Measure
startbasemeasure.remarks: An absolute measure that is calculated by converting from the end measure using a defined conversion method.  Conversion methods are defined in the Assets application using the Add/Modify Conversions action.

endzoffsetref.title: End Z Offset Referent
endzoffsetref.remarks: Point from which the Z-Offset is measured.

metername.title: Meter
metername.remarks: Identifier for the meter attached to the asset, for example HOURS or KILOMETERS.

startoffset.title: Start Offset
startoffset.remarks: Distance used in conjunction with the start reference point to determine where the meter resides.

endassetfeatureid.title: End Asset Feature ID
endassetfeatureid.remarks: A previously defined feature or relationship used, in conjunction with the end offset, to determine the end measure for this meter.

dorollover.title: Rollover
dorollover.remarks: non-persistent attribute to indicate if a new reading should cause the meter to roll over

slidingwindowsize.title: Sliding Window Size
slidingwindowsize.remarks: The number of readings, days, weeks or months to include in a sliding average meter unit calculation.

pointnum.title: Point
pointnum.remarks: identifier of this AssetMeter's related condition monitoring point.

average.title: Average Units/Day
average.remarks: Average units per day for this meter

endfeature.title: End Feature
endfeature.remarks: The feature (e.g. mile marker) that is used to identify where, on the linear asset, the meter reading was taken.

lastreadingdate.title: Last Reading Date
lastreadingdate.remarks: Date of the last reading for this meter.

linearassetmeterid.title: Linear Specification Id
linearassetmeterid.remarks: Part of the primary key to differentiate Linear asset meters only.

endoffset.title: End Offset
endoffset.remarks: Distance used in conjunction with the end reference point to determine where the meter resides.

lastreading.title: Last Reading
lastreading.remarks: Last reading taken for this meter. This should be the same as the most recent meter reading. An asset that was used before it was added to the system will have an asset meter reading. The last meter reading for an existing asset can be used as the initial meter reading for that asset in the system.

islinear.title: Is Linear
islinear.remarks: Is this measurement for a linear asset?

startassetfeatureid.title: Start Feature
startassetfeatureid.remarks: A previously defined feature or relationship used, in conjunction with the start offset, to determine the start measure for this measurement.

endoffset.title: End Offset
endoffset.remarks: Distance used in conjunction with the end reference point to determine where the measurement was taken.

startmeasure.title: Start Measure
startmeasure.remarks: Absolute distance taken from the start of the linear asset to where this measurement was taken.  This can be manually entered or calculated by entering a start reference point and start offset.

endoffsetunitid.title: Unit of End Offset
endoffsetunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for the offset (before or after) from the end reference point where this measurement was taken.

endzoffset.title: End Z Offset
endzoffset.remarks: Distance above or below this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet above the road, the  Z-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Z  Reference Point and can be positive (above) or negative (below).

endyoffsetref.title: End Y Offset Referent
endyoffsetref.remarks: Point from which the Y Offset is measured, for example, centerline or edge. The system administrator can create a domain for this purpose.  The value entered will not be used in calculations, it is simply used to locate the feature in the field.

startzoffset.title: Start Z Offset
startzoffset.remarks: Distance above or below this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet above the road, the  Z-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Z  Reference Point and can be positive (above) or negative (below).

startzoffsetref.title: Start Z Offset Referent
startzoffsetref.remarks: Reference point from which the start Z-Offset (distance above or below the linear asset) is measured.

startyoffsetref.title: Start Y Offset Referent
startyoffsetref.remarks: Point from which the Y Offset is measured, for example, centerline or edge.  The system administrator can create a domain for this purpose.  The value entered will not be used in calculations, it is simply used to locate the feature in the field.

endbasemeasure.title: End Base Measure
endbasemeasure.remarks: An absolute measure that is calculated by converting from the end measure using a defined conversion method.  Conversion methods are defined in the Assets application using the Add/Modify Conversions action.

observation.title: Observation
observation.remarks: Reading taken on a CHARACTERISTIC meter.  Valid values are from the ALNDOMAINVALUE table where the domain identifier is the same as the meter's domain identifier.

basemeasureunitid.title: Unit of Base Measure
basemeasureunitid.remarks: Usually, this is the same as the unit of measure  for the asset. If they differ, Maximo will display measures in the unit of measure but will store measures in both the unit of measure and base unit of measure.  A conversion between the unit of measure and base unit of measure, entered via the Units of Measure and Conversion Action in Assets, must exist if the base unit of measure differs from the unit of measure.

endmeasure.title: End Measure
endmeasure.remarks: Absolute distance taken from the start of the linear asset to where this measurement was taken.  This can be manually entered or calculated by entering an end reference point and end offset.

startyoffset.title: Start Y Offset
startyoffset.remarks: Perpendicular distance from this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet to the right of the road, the Y-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Y Reference Point and can be positive (right) or negative (left).

evaluatedforwogen.title: Evaluate For WO Generation
evaluatedforwogen.remarks: Has this linear measurement been considered for work order generation?

startoffsetunitid.title: Unit of Start Offset
startoffsetunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for the offset (before or after) from the start reference point where this measurement was taken.

endyoffset.title: End Y Offset
endyoffset.remarks: Perpendicular distance from this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet to the right of the road, the Y-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Y Reference Point and can be positive (right) or negative (left).

workorderid.title: Work Order ID
workorderid.remarks: Identifier of the work order generated for this measurement.

startoffset.title: Start Offset
startoffset.remarks: Distance used in conjunction with the start reference point to determine where the measurement was taken.

endassetfeatureid.title: End Feature
endassetfeatureid.remarks: A previously defined feature or relationship used, in conjunction with the end offset to determine the end measure for this measurement.

location.title: Location
location.remarks: Location on this Measurement's MeasurePoint, AssetMeter or LocationMeter.

measurementid.title: Measurement
measurementid.remarks: Unique identifier for this measurement. This value is automatically generated for each new measurement.

startbasemeasure.title: Start Base Measure
startbasemeasure.remarks: An absolute measure that is calculated by converting from the end measure using a defined conversion method.  Conversion methods are defined in the Assets application using the Add/Modify Conversions action.

endzoffsetref.title: End Z Offset Referent
endzoffsetref.remarks: Point from which the Z-Offset is measured.

endyoffsetref.title: End Y Offset Referent
endyoffsetref.remarks: The point from which the Y Offset is measured (e.g. centerline, edge, etc).   The user can create a domain for this purpose.  The value entered will not be used in calculations, it is simply used to locate the feature in the field.

startzoffset.title: Start Z Offset
startzoffset.remarks: Distance above or below this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet above the road, the  Z-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Z  Reference Point and can be positive (above) or negative (below).

rollover.title: Rollover
rollover.remarks: Point at which the asset's meter returns to the its mininum value. Rollover applies to CONTINUOUS meters only.

startzoffsetref.title: Start Z Offset Referent
startzoffsetref.remarks: Reference point from which the start Z-Offset (distance above or below the linear asset) is measured.

startyoffsetref.title: Start Y Offset Referent
startyoffsetref.remarks: The point from which the Y Offset is measured (e.g. centerline, edge, etc).   The user can create a domain for this purpose.  The value entered will not be used in calculations, it is simply used to locate the feature in the field.

avgcalcmethod.title: Average Calculation Method
avgcalcmethod.remarks: Method used to calculate the average meter units per day: STATIC, ALL or SLIDING.

changeby.title: Changed By
changeby.remarks: Name of user who last modified this record.

endmeasure.title: End Measure
endmeasure.remarks: Absolute distance taken from the start of the linear asset to where this meter is defined.  This can be manually entered or calculated by entering an end reference point and end offset.

startyoffset.title: Start Y Offset
startyoffset.remarks: Perpendicular distance from this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet to the right of the road, the Y-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Y Reference Point and can be positive (right) or negative (left).

lastreadinginspctr.title: Last Reading Inspector
lastreadinginspctr.remarks: inspector for this meter's most recent meter reading

endfeatureid.title: EndFeature ID
endfeatureid.remarks: unique identifier for the feature that marks the end of the section of the linear asset for which this meter applies

endyoffset.title: End Y Offset
endyoffset.remarks: Perpendicular distance from this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet to the right of the road, the Y-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Y Reference Point and can be positive (right) or negative (left).

lifetodate.title: Life to Date for Asset
lifetodate.remarks: This value tracks the total use of an asset over its life span. It will always be equal to or exceed the last reading value and is used to determine the meter-based PM frequencies. If a meter does not roll over and is never replaced or reset, this value is the same as the last reading.  Even if the meter rolls over or the physical meter is replaced or reset, this value continues to increase because the value is based on the asset.

sincelastoverhaul.title: Since Last Overhaul
sincelastoverhaul.remarks: Difference between the current meter reading and the meter reading when the last work order of type OVERHAUL was opened or closed as determined by application setup.

previousreading.title: Previous Reading
previousreading.remarks: non-persistent attribute that is the reading just previous to the meter reading being added or updated.

readingtype.title: Reading Type
readingtype.remarks: reading type (CONTINUOUS or DELTA) for this meter.

rolldownsource.title: Accept Rolldown From
rolldownsource.remarks: Identifies whether or not an asset's meter accepts a reading delta from a parent asset's or location's meter. A value of NONE indicates that this Meter does not accept rolled down parent readings.

startbasemeasure.title: Start Base Measure
startbasemeasure.remarks: An absolute measure that is calculated by converting from the end measure using a defined conversion method.  Conversion methods are defined in the Assets application using the Add/Modify Conversions action.

endzoffsetref.title: End Z Offset Referent
endzoffsetref.remarks: Point from which the Z-Offset is measured.

remarks.title: Remarks
remarks.remarks: Additional information supplied by the user regarding the record.

estendoflife.title: Estimated EOL
estendoflife.remarks: The date when the asset reaches its end of life. This date is based on the condition of the asset.

industryhealthgrade.title: Industry Standard Health Grade
industryhealthgrade.remarks: Industry standard health grade in alphanumeric format

priority.title: Priority
priority.remarks: Asset Priority will copied to Work Order when entered.

groupname.title: Meter Group
groupname.remarks: All meters belonging to this asset's metergroup are automatically associated with this Asset in the AssetMeter object. Additions to the meter group may also be added to this Asset's AssetMeters.

rolltoallchildren.title: Roll New Status to All Child Assets
rolltoallchildren.remarks: Roll New Status to All Child Assets

pluscismteclass.title: M&TE Classification
pluscismteclass.remarks: If the Is (M&TE) checkbox is selected, specify the classification for tool.

saddresscode.title: Service Address
saddresscode.remarks: The address code identifies a service address. It must be unique by site for each service address.

status.title: Status
status.remarks: Status of the asset, for example, not ready, operating, or decommissioned.

hierarchypath.title: Hierarchy Path
hierarchypath.remarks: Sets value to HIERARCHYPATH, if the asset has an associated CLASSSTRUCTURE record

country.title: Country
country.remarks: The country of the service address.

parent.title: Parent Address
parent.remarks: The reference to the parent service address. In case this attribute is null, then it means this Service Address is a root.

latitudey.title: Latitude(Y)
latitudey.remarks: The measurement, in degrees, that the service address is north or south of the equator. Latitude is used with longitude to locate a place on a map. You must specify latitude in decimal degrees.

staddrdirprfx.title: Direction Prefix
staddrdirprfx.remarks: A street direction prefix is part of an address that indicates the cardinal point of a compass, for example, N Florida Ave.

city.title: City
city.remarks: The city of the service address.

timezone.title: Time Zone
timezone.remarks: The time zone of the service address.

county.title: County
county.remarks: The county of the service address.

referencepoint.title: Reference Point
referencepoint.remarks: A reference point to help to locate the service address, for example, '300 feet behind large red outbuilding.'

description.title: Description
description.remarks: The description of the service address.

staddrnumber.title: House Number
staddrnumber.remarks: The building number of the service address.

addresscode.title: Address Code
addresscode.remarks: The address code identifies a service address. It must be unique by site for each service address.

staddrunitnum.title: Apartment/Unit/Suite
staddrunitnum.remarks: An optional part of a street address that identifies whether the address is an apartment, a unit, or a suite, for example.

postalcode.title: Zip/Postal Code
postalcode.remarks: The postal code of the service address.

wkid.title: Spatial Reference WKID
wkid.remarks: The spatial reference WKID of the Service Address.

streetaddress.title: Street Address
streetaddress.remarks: The street address details of the service address, such as the house number, the street direction prefix, and the name of the street. Additional details can include the type of street, the street direction suffix, and whether the address is an apartment, a unit, or a suite.

staddrstreet.title: Street Name
staddrstreet.remarks: The name of the street on which the service address is located.

staddrsttype.title: Street Type
staddrsttype.remarks: The type of street on which the service address is located, such as avenue, circle, parkway, road, street, lane, court, boulevard, or terrace.

objectname.title: Maximo Object
objectname.remarks: The object name following internal Maximo domain for objects

formattedaddress.title: Formatted Address
formattedaddress.remarks: This address is formatted according to the map provider's requirements and is updated when a location is found on the map tab. Formatted addresses are used to search for addresses on the map tab.

stateprovince.title: State/Province
stateprovince.remarks: The state or the province of the service address.

orgid.title: Organization
orgid.remarks: The organization identifier that is assigned to this service address.

staddrdirsfx.title: Direction Suffix
staddrdirsfx.remarks: A street direction suffix is part of an address that indicates the cardinal point of a compass, for example Florida Ave. N.

directions.title: Directions
directions.remarks: Directions to help locate the service address.

regiondistrict.title: Region/District
regiondistrict.remarks: The region or district of the service address.

geocode.title: GEO Code
geocode.remarks: GEO code for calculation of sales tax.

longitudex.title: Longitude(X)
longitudex.remarks: The measurement, in degrees, that the service address is east or west of the prime meridian. Longitude is used with latitude to locate a place on a map. You must specify longitude in decimal degrees.

pluscassetdept.title: Asset Department
pluscassetdept.remarks: Enter an asset department or click Select Value and choose one from the list.

plusciscondesc.title: Is Contaminated Description
plusciscondesc.remarks: This field is available when the Is Contaminated? Field is selected. It is used to enter a description of the contamination or other pertinent information.

pluscloopnum.title: Loop Number
pluscloopnum.remarks: Enter the loop number of the asset, if applicable.

pluscoprgefrom.title: Operating Range From
pluscoprgefrom.remarks: Enter the minimum numeric value of the operating range of the tool. This field is used in conjuction with the Operating Range To field.

autolocate.title: Formatted Geometry
autolocate.remarks: String representation of the record geometry

startdescription.title: Asset Start
startdescription.remarks: Free-form text describing the start of this linear asset.

pluscpmextdate.title: Extend Date
pluscpmextdate.remarks: This check box is selected if the date of the associated PM is extended.

assettype.title: Type
assettype.remarks: The predefined type of this asset.

conditioncode.title: Condition Code
conditioncode.remarks: The item condition of the asset

description_longdescription.title: Details
description_longdescription.remarks: Long Description for Asset Short Description (One Line)

endmeasure.title: End Measure
endmeasure.remarks: A value that identifies the end of the linear asset.  The absolute value of the end measure minus the start measure will determine the length of the linear asset.  The start measure and the end measure also determine the boundary measures for any features or relationships applied to the asset.

expectedlife.title: Expected Life
expectedlife.remarks: Expected life of the asset, expressed in years.  This value is based on the typical useful life that a manufacturer or industry standard recommends for an asset or asset type.

budgetcost.title: Budgeted
budgetcost.remarks: Budgeted Cost Of Work For The Year

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.remarks: Non persistent fields to access the MBO geometry

tloamhash.title: Partition ID
tloamhash.remarks: The unique ID which is used to identify a partition from a discovery perspective.  This field can be used by reconciliation to link and audit authorized partitions.

autowogen.title: Automatically Generate Work Orders
autowogen.remarks: Flag that indicates whether to start the wogen process when meter frequency is reached for an asset

pmnextfaildt.title: Predicted next failure date
pmnextfaildt.remarks: Predicted next failure date from Prescriptive Maintenance on Cloud

pluscismte.title: Is M&TE
pluscismte.remarks: When selected, indicates that the selected equipment is a piece of measurement and test equipment. The default for this check box is cleared (not M&TE).

pluscduedate.title: Calibration Due Date
pluscduedate.remarks: The date that the next 'Cal' work type PM will be generated

pluscmodelnum.title: Model Number
pluscmodelnum.remarks: Enter the model number of the tool, if applicable. This field may be populated from the Assets (Cal) application.

returnedtovendor.title: Returned To Vendor
returnedtovendor.remarks: Indicates whether the current asset was returned to the responsible vendor.

changepmstatus.title: Change the Status of All Associated PMs to Inactive
changepmstatus.remarks: Change the Status of All Associated PMs to Inactive

lrm.title: LRM
lrm.remarks: The Linear Referencing Method for this asset.  Defined using the Add/Modify Linear Referencing Methods Action, an LRM is a means for locating any point (e.g. feature, relationship, work) along the linear asset using a measure and a known point.  Changing the LRM is not recommended unless the base unit of measure is the same in the new LRM.

templateid.title: Asset Template
templateid.remarks: Identifies the asset template. Enter a value to identify a new asset template. This value must be unique for all asset templates.

removefromactiveroutes.title: Remove Asset Reference from Active Routes
removefromactiveroutes.remarks: Remove Asset Reference from Active Routes

plusclploc.title: Loop Location
plusclploc.remarks: Defines the location number of the associated Loop Calibration record. To modify a loop location, click Move/Modify Assets or from the Select Action menu, select Move/Modify Assets.

islinear.title: Linear
islinear.remarks: When checked, identifies an asset as a linear asset (e.g. road, railway).

iscalibration.title: Calibration
iscalibration.remarks: Determines whether an asset is calibrated. If you select this checkbox, the calibration details are available. Specify the calibration details for the asset.

currentstatus.title: Current Status
currentstatus.remarks: Asset's current IsRunning status, that is, is the asset up or down?

isdowntimereport.title: Down Time Report
isdowntimereport.remarks: if true, full-cycle downtime reporting is being performed, that is, when going from IsRunning to -(IsRunning) back to IsRunning in one action. Downtime reporting will insert two AssetStatus records, or update one and insert another AssetStatus record.

operational.title: Operational
operational.remarks: Is downtime occurring when asset normally in use?

startdate.title: Start Date
startdate.remarks: Start of the down time interval. Can be from workorder.enterdate,workorder.actstart or the most recent assetstatus.changedate for the assetnum on the owning work order object

statuschangedate.title: Status Date
statuschangedate.remarks: date of asset status change from IsRunning to not IsRunning. When going from IsRunning to not IsRunning back to IsRunning in one action that is, downtime reporting, the StartDate and EndDate attributes are used, and this attribute is read-only.

downtime.title: Hours
downtime.remarks: interval between start date and end date. Value can be also be affected by Asset's calendar or UI override.

enddate.title: End Date
enddate.remarks: end of the down time interval

statuschangecode.title: Downtime Code
statuschangecode.remarks: reason for asset status change from IsRunning to not IsRunning. When going from IsRunning to not IsRunning back to IsRunning in one action (that is, downtime reporting), the Code attribute is used, and this attribute is read-only.

startdatesource.title: Start Date Source
startdatesource.remarks: Specifies origin of startdate for downtime reporting. Value will be from the ReportDate or ActStart attribute of the workorder. Valid values are REPORTDATE ACTSTART or NONE.

description.title: Description
description.remarks: Describes the asset. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button.

pluscsumdir.title: Applied As
pluscsumdir.remarks: Enter the direction of the accuracy fields (%Span, %URV, and %Reading). Valid entries are  +, -, and +/-.

pluscduedate_np.title: Calibration Due Date
pluscduedate_np.remarks: The date when the calibration of the asset is due.

defaultrepfac.title: Default Repair Facility
defaultrepfac.remarks: The default repair facility that is assigned to work orders generated for PMs and Condition Monitoring. The repair facility can be changed during the manual work order generation process.

plusciscontam.title: Is Contaminated
plusciscontam.remarks: When selected, indicates that this tool is contaminated and allows you to enter a description of the contamination. The default is this field is cleared.

linkedtosection.title: Linked to Section
linkedtosection.remarks: This section is linked to another section in this specification.

startassetfeatureid.title: Start Asset Feature ID
startassetfeatureid.remarks: A previously defined feature or relationship used, in conjunction with the start offset, to determine the start measure for this attribute value.

linkedtoattribute.title: Linked to Attribute
linkedtoattribute.remarks: This attribute is linked to another attribute in this specification.

section.title: Section
section.remarks: Section for a group of attributes

startmeasure.title: Start Measure
startmeasure.remarks: Absolute distance taken from the start of the linear asset to where the current value for this attribute is initially encountered.  This can be manually entered or calculated by entering a start reference point and start offset.

endoffsetunitid.title: Unit of End Offset
endoffsetunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for the offset (before or after) from the end reference point of this attribute.

assetattrid.title: Attribute
assetattrid.remarks: The name of an attribute defined for the classification specified for this asset. Create and manage classifications in the Classifications application.

endzoffset.title: End Z Offset
endzoffset.remarks: Distance above or below this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet above the road, the  Z-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Z  Reference Point and can be positive (above) or negative (below).

continuous.title: Continuous
continuous.remarks: Specifies whether the attribute is continuous. If the check box is selected, it is continuous. A continuous attribute exists for the entire span of the linear asset with which it is associated. To satisfy this condition you can create a single attribute record whose start and end measures equal the start and end measures of the linear asset. You can also create multiple attributes records that together cover the entire linear asset without overlapping.  To validate this property, run the Gap and Overlap report. If the check box is cleared (the default), you can apply the attribute to a segment of the linear asset.

endbasemeasure.title: End Base Measure
endbasemeasure.remarks: An absolute measure that is calculated by converting from the end measure using a defined conversion method.  Conversion methods are defined in the Assets application using the Add/Modify Conversions action.

startoffsetunitid.title: Unit of Start Offset
startoffsetunitid.remarks: Unit of measure for the offset (before or after) from the start reference point of this attribute.

measureunitid.title: Unit of Measure
measureunitid.remarks: A unit of measure specified for this classification attribute

startoffset.title: Start Offset
startoffset.remarks: Distance used in conjunction with the start reference point to determine where the current attribute value for the asset begins.

endassetfeatureid.title: End Asset Feature ID
endassetfeatureid.remarks: A previously defined feature or relationship used, in conjunction with the end offset, to determine the end measure for this attribute value.

endoffset.title: End Offset
endoffset.remarks: Distance used in conjunction with the end reference point to determine where the current attribute value for the asset ends.

itemspecvalchanged.title: Item Specification Value Changed
itemspecvalchanged.remarks: Item Specification value changed after being inherited? N if value not changed and N if value not inherited from item specification.

endyoffsetref.title: End Y Offset Referent
endyoffsetref.remarks: The point from which the End Y Offset is measured (e.g. centerline, edge).

startzoffset.title: Start Z Offset
startzoffset.remarks: Distance above or below this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet above the road, the  Z-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Z  Reference Point and can be positive (above) or negative (below).

startzoffsetref.title: Start Z Offset Referent
startzoffsetref.remarks: Reference point from which the start Z-Offset (distance above or below the linear asset) is measured.

startyoffsetref.title: Start Y Offset Referent
startyoffsetref.remarks: The point from which the Start Y Offset is measured (e.g. centerline, edge, etc).

changeby.title: Changed By
changeby.remarks: User name who last changed record.

endmeasure.title: End Measure
endmeasure.remarks: Absolute distance taken from the start of the linear asset to where the current value for this attribute ends.  This can be manually entered or calculated by entering an end reference point and end offset.

startyoffset.title: Start Y Offset
startyoffset.remarks: Perpendicular distance from this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet to the right of the road, the Y-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Y Reference Point and can be positive (right) or negative (left).

linearassetspecid.title: Linear Specification Id
linearassetspecid.remarks: Part of the primary key to differentiate Linear asset specifications only.

tablevalue.title: Table Value
tablevalue.remarks: The value from the table specified in the DOMAIN where the domaintype and datatype is TABLE.

endyoffset.title: End Y Offset
endyoffset.remarks: Perpendicular distance from this linear asset.  For example, if a sign is 10 feet to the right of the road, the Y-Offset is 10 feet.  This value is measured from the Y Reference Point and can be positive (right) or negative (left).

startbasemeasure.title: Start Base Measure
startbasemeasure.remarks: An absolute measure that is calculated by converting from the end measure using a defined conversion method.  Conversion methods are defined in the Assets application using the Add/Modify Conversions action.

endzoffsetref.title: End Z Offset Referent
endzoffsetref.remarks: Point from which the Z-Offset is measured.

direction.title: Direction
direction.remarks: Direction of this linear asset, for example North, South, East or West

pluscclass.title: Class
pluscclass.remarks: Enter a value or click Select Value and choose an asset classification of the tool.

pluscsumread.title: % READING
pluscsumread.remarks: This field is summed with the %Span, %URV, and Accuracy EU fields to obtain the total accuracy of the asset.

pluscoprgeeu.title: Units
pluscoprgeeu.remarks: Enter the engineering units for the Operating Range values or click Select Value and choose the units from the list.

invcost.title: Inventory Cost
invcost.remarks: Cost on WO or PO Line items flagged as CHARGESTORE

glaccount.title: GL Account
glaccount.remarks: GL Account Code for the Asset

pluscsumurv.title: %URV
pluscsumurv.remarks: This field is summed with the %Span, %Reading, and Accuracy EU fields to obtain the total accuracy of the asset.

defaultrepfacsiteid.title: Repair Facility Site
defaultrepfacsiteid.remarks: The site for the repair facility.

well_maintained.title: Prescriptive Maintenance on Cloud WELL_MAINTAINED
well_maintained.remarks: An attribute that is used in Prescriptive Maintenance on Cloud to specify the number of days before the next predicted failure date that scheduled maintenance can occur and the asset can be categorized as well maintained

pluscphyloc.title: Physical Location
pluscphyloc.remarks: Actual physical location of the asset.
